channel.title: Quality Music Visualization Renders for Cheap?
channel.description:
I have really been wanting to start putting content on my YouTube Channel but I have realized that I need a software that can take music and create a "visualization" of frequency bars on the screen, sorta like how NCS does their music videos. I have searched and searched for a quality software that can accomplish this at a low price (preferably less than 70 USD). Does anyone have or know of a software or similar software to what I'm talking about?
It would be really helpful if anyone who knows anything about this could contribute. Thanks
Voltt

So full the full Auxy + visualizer thing can be done genuinely as long as you have both an iOS device and an Android OS device‚Ä¶ in my own opinion theres no point looking for free visualizers for iOS like i used to because Apple hardware just doesn‚Äôt like to support third-party services that much.

item.source: Quality Music Visualization Renders for Cheap?

item.title: Quality Music Visualization Renders for Cheap?
item.dc:creator: Db909
item.description:
There are no truly good, truly customizable visualizer makers on iOS that I have found. I‚Äôve looked pretty hard. Klevgrand has one called Wizibel that people seem to appreciate but many have said that the themes are limited and it‚Äôs been out for a while now. For a truly customizable visualizer, we need a particle fx app that has audio reactive abilities built in and isn‚Äôt a pain to work with. This is definitely a gap in the market, in terms of user friendly visual animation with audio programs. Maybe there‚Äôs something on desktop. But I‚Äôm sure many would appreciate, for example, not having to learn After effects or some other complicated thing, when all we want are some cool swooshes and whooshes that play along with the music. Should be simple, but nobody‚Äôs done it it seems. And beware of visualizer apps with tons of gorgeous visuals where nothing is actually reacting to the music save for the little spectrum bar pasted over all the really cool stuff.

Read full topic
